link.synopsis: The fortunes of down-on-his-luck crooner Asfour (Farid Al Atrache) change overnight when he discovers a mysterious lamp housing a charming genie (Samia Gamal) in this sweet comedy. She can make anything he wishes come true, so he asks for help in luring his distracted girlfriend from the charms of a rich competitor. But Asfour soon learns he should be careful what to wish for, as he soon realizes his heart may lie elsewhere.

link.synopsis: David Cross and Bob Odenkirk broke new ground in the arena of sketch comedy -- and earned themselves a legion of fans -- with this absurdist HBO series that draws on the talents of performers like Brian Posehn, Scott Adsit and Jill Talley. Standout sketches from the show's fourth and final season include "Wyckyd Sceptre," "Burgundy Loafe," "Teardrop Awards," "Monk Academy" and "The Story of Everest."

After he's "toynapped" by a greedy collector, Woody discovers that he's a prized collectible for a 1950s kiddie-puppet TV show. Buzz Lightyear and Woody's other toy friends waste no time plotting his rescue.

link.synopsis: This 1980s comedy peeked in on the lives of several quirky residents at an apartment complex, with the Jenkins family -- homemaker Mary (Marla Gibbs), contractor Lester (Hal Williams) and their daughter, Brenda (Regina King) -- taking center stage. Mary's best friend, Rose (Alaina Reed Hall), also lives there, but it's their neighbor Sandra (Jackee) who's usually the topic of conversation due to her revolving door of boyfriends.

link.synopsis: The award-winning producers of Urban Latino TV and the pages of &NFi;Urban Latino Magazine&NFi_; give you an inside look at the Urban Latino Movement. It's the story of a people on the move, and the stories are as diverse as the people themselves. From college students to entrepreneurs of music, fashion, art, sports, comedy and entertainment, Urban Latino TV introduces viewers to the movers and shakers of this new movement that's sweeping America.

link.synopsis: Clumsy bellboy Stanley Belt (Jerry Lewis) becomes a celebrity in this comedy. After a money-making star dies unexpectedly, the dead man's managers (Everett Sloane, Phil Harris, Keenan Wynn, Peter Lorre, John Carradine and Ina Balin) decide to manufacture a new cash cow. Stanley is trained as a singer and, despite his spastic behavior, records a hit single, winning a spot on "The Ed Sullivan Show." But there's one huge problem: The show is live.

After swearing to commit suicide one year from the accident, the pals carry out a series of wild dares -- punching a cop, doing hard drugs, burning down the school. Throughout their antics, the boys come to question their pact in Suri Krishnamma's wild comedy drama.

link.synopsis: The consumer-driven suburban American world of the 1950s is sharply satirized in this one-act opera composed by Leonard Bernstein in 1951. Bernstein conducts the London Symphonic Wind Band, and the dynamic young cast includes Nancy Williams, Julian Patrick, Antonia Butler, Michael Clarke and Mark Brown.

Once there, he becomes the captive of a deranged mutant-making madman (Randy Quaid). Transformed into a freak by Zygrot-27, Coogan leads a mutant revolt in this bizarre comedy co-starring Michael Stoyanov and Megan Ward.

link.synopsis: Charlie Chaplin promotes Liberty Bonds in The Bond and boosts troop morale in the slapstick boot-camp comedy Shoulder Arms, two of four films from the years 1917-18 in this installment of the comprehensive Chaplin collection. Just 25 in 1914 when these films were shot, Chaplin creates brilliant silent comedy mayhem in his portrayals of the Tramp, a flirtatious dental assistant, a drunk and many other characters.

link.synopsis: A timid suitor seeks the help of a ruthless colonel to win the woman of his dreams in this classic romantic comedy from Basu Chatterji and B.R. Chopra. Unable to express his feelings, meek Arun (Amol Palekar) admires the beautiful Prabha (Vidya Sinha) from afar. But when a bold young man (Asrani) begins to pursue Prabha, Arun turns to Col. J.N.W. Singh (Ashok Kumar), who applies military tactics and transforms the Milquetoast into a love-warrior.

link.synopsis: From writer-director Christopher Payne comes this offbeat comedy about slacker Anthony "Spider" Dale (Andy Serkis), who proposes to his girlfriend, creating unexpected ripple effects throughout his gang of beer-swilling bachelor buddies. Skillfully lensed to resemble a prewedding video memento for Spider, this insightful British charmer also stars Sacha Baron Cohen, Rebecca Craig, Milo Twomey and Jo Martin.

link.synopsis: Robert De Niro stars in his first leading film role in this satirical comedy set in 1960s New York City. The story follows the antics of three counterculture friends (Jonathan Warden, Gerrit Graham and De Niro): one trying to fail an Army physical, one who spins conspiracy theories and one who's a would-be filmmaker and voyeur. Directed by Brian De Palma, the movie pokes fun at free love, the Vietnam War and even John Kennedy's assassination.

link.synopsis: Matthew George's award-winning dark comedy centers on four angry men duped by a slick-talking con man. Financial ruin awaits when Brad (Stephen Pease), Carl (Lachy Hulme), Trevor (Adam Haddrick) and Scott (Alan King) invest in a five-star restaurant with businessman Phil (David Serafin). When it becomes clear the restaurant is hemorrhaging money and Phil's a crook, revenge comes swiftly in the dark of night and suspicion surrounds all four men.

Determined to protect his mother from the wastrel, son Alistair (Richard E. Grant) tracks his pop to the seedy resort where he's living -- and soon finds that his mission may be more difficult to carry out than he'd anticipated. Michael Austin directs.

link.synopsis: Revealing conversation floods the ladies' room in this bittersweet comedy with two intertwining tales. The first vignette captures the loaded exchange between three actresses forced to prepare for a show in the rest room. Meanwhile, a woman (Veronica Ferres) runs into her lover's (John Malkovich) pregnant wife (Greta Scacchi) in the opera house bathroom, and the two engage in a tête-a-tête of life, love and marriage. Lorraine Bracco co-stars.

link.synopsis: Director Saul Metzstein's quirky comedy captures the anxiety, arrogance and nonsense of youth as it follows four friends, all grave-shift workers who meet nightly at a 24-hour coffee house. Stuck in dead-end jobs, Sean (Luke de Woolfson), Vincent (James Lance), Lenny (Enzo Cilenti) and Jody (Kate Ashfield) ponder their dreary existence and trade notes about their personal lives. But things change when Vincent unwittingly beds Sean's girl.

link.synopsis: Performed by the Gewandhaus Orchestra, this skillfully abridged adaptation of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart's brilliant comic opera is a delightful family treat. Lavish sets and costumes (and a cast adept at playing comedy) complement and complete the Austrian composer's glorious music. link.synopsis: Released by Ealing Studios after World War II, director Charles Crichton's rib tickler captures the "take charge" spirit of many Brits. When British Railways announces the closure of the Titfield line, citizens try to run it themselves -- but the local bus company is out to shut down the competition. With money and pride at stake, the battle lines are drawn in this boisterous comedy starring Stanley Holloway, George Relph and Naunton Wayne.

This classic Bollywood comedy also stars Rashid Khan as the bootlegger Kailash, Nemo as the counterfeiter Ramnarayan Malik, and Sulochana Chatterjee as the unassuming wife of a degenerate gambler.

When mistresses Page and Ford receive almost identical love letters from Falstaff, they unite in a scheme to get revenge on the portly knight.

link.synopsis: B.R. Chopra directs this rollicking comedy that proves you can have your cake and eat it, too. Sanjeev Kumar stars as a doting husband who just can't help his roving eye at the office. Pretending to be miserable and trapped in a loveless marriage to an invalid spouse, he wins the sympathy -- and affections -- of his pretty young secretary (Ranjeeta). Now, his life is paradise twice over: happily married at home and blissfully in love at work!

But the rookie criminals make a huge mistake when they accidentally grab the wrong girl (Tori Spelling). What started out as a simple plan turns into a big mess as the friends struggle to keep up with their hostage's demands. Sean Devine, Danny Strong and Mark Burgess star in this comedy.

Blackwel may be crude, but he's smart enough to know that sexy women are a surefire distraction on the way to the library. Toss in some wild parties and Chip may never see his fortune.

Transplanted Hollywood resident Jimmy Alto (Joe Pesci) knows he's made for the bright lights of stardom, but no one else in the business appears to agree. Fueled with rage and resentment after his car is broken into and his radio pilfered, Jimmy wages a war that lands him and his sidekick (Christian Slater) more publicity than two wannabe actors could ever imagine.

link.synopsis: British director Coky Giedroyc's bittersweet comedy follows quiet Ellen (Gina McKee) and off-the-wall single mother Cora (Helena Bonham Carter), whose unlikely yet enduring friendship helps them survive heartbreak, pregnancy and divorce. But when a shocking secret of Cora's comes to light, it threatens to end their relationship. The first-rate supporting cast includes James Purefoy, James Nesbitt, Kenneth Cranham and Eileen Atkins.

link.synopsis: Brendan Delaney (Robbie Coltrane) is a university janitor with a problem: His daughter's been accepted to medical school, but he's gambled away her college savings. Fortunately, Brendan meets Bobby, an aborigine with a knack for picking winners. Unfortunately, Bobby has been dead for centuries and is now nothing but a head in a jar. To make matters worse, everyone else is trying to get Bobby, too, in this screwy comedy co-starring Dan Aykroyd.

link.synopsis: As tensions mount between lovers Des (Nick Moran) and Lauren (Lisa Faulkner), Des and his friend Frank (Philip Davis) become desperate for a quick source of cash. An aging gangster who is in prison has a vial of his "baby juice" smuggled out every month to try to impregnate his girlfriend, Trixie (Samantha Janus). Knowing about his scheme to carry on his family lineage, Des and Frank decide to hold the sperm ransom in this raucous British comedy.

link.synopsis: Israeli director Boaz Davidson lenses a touching and funny coming-of-age film about 13-year-old Alex, who falls head over heels in love for the first time. This romantic comedy set during the years of Israeli independence gets pretty racy, with a major twist thrown in the mix when Lola, a seductive older relative from Poland, enters the scene. Overnight, Alex's crush on a schoolgirl deflates, eclipsed by the presence of this ravishing new woman.

Filmed in mockumentary style, 3-Play uses testimonials and flashbacks to examine love relationships from many angles.

link.synopsis: Filmed for British television, this 1988 production of William Shakespeare's gender-bending comedy stars Frances Barber as Viola, who takes advantage of a chance to start over by disguising herself as her presumed-dead twin brother. But the cross-dressing deception leads to a romantic muddle when she goes to work for a lovelorn nobleman (Christopher Ravenscroft). The solid cast also includes Richard Briers and Caroline Langrishe.

link.synopsis: When a black soldier travels back home on a weekend pass, his thoughts invariably turn to lust … and he's got just two days to translate his fevered daydreams into reality. Unfortunately, none of the women he meets seem to share his ideas. It's comedy hip-hop style, with plenty of male machismo and female dissin' thrown in for good measure. Stars Gordon Eriksen, James Haig, Kevin Haig, Heather Johnston and Monica Sparrow.

link.synopsis: Get a taste of television "old school" style when you view this packed video featuring classic entertainers at the very peak of their careers -- be it variety, comedy, drama, music or sports (even vintage commercials are included). See "The Edsel Hour" with Frank Sinatra, Bob Hope, Bing Crosby and Louis Armstrong singing up a storm. Also, see another side of John Wayne, Cybill Shepherd, Tom Selleck and others … in commercials!

These musical chameleons first captured the public's attention when they appeared as the memorable surprise guests at the Eurovision Grand Prix de la Chanson in Kiel, Germany.

link.synopsis: In this independent ensemble comedy, four improvisatory comedians brimming with edge -- all New Yorkers -- struggle with the age-old issues of loving, committing to and understanding the various women in their lives. It's true, life  can  sometimes feel like four dead batteries in need of a spark plug. Rob Webber, Dave Zubradt, Benjamin Travers and Patrick Dall'Occhio star; Hiram Martinez directs.

Opium and the Kung Fu Master
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Max (Gary Lundy) lives and breathes Woody Allen's seminal film, Annie Hall. In fact, Max believes the movie's message underscores the ultimate futility of romance. But just when Max begins to suspect that the movie is ruining his love life, a girl (Sara Downing) who seems to be the modern incarnation of Annie Hall herself turns his world topsy-turvy. Eat your heart out, Diane Keaton. Van Flesher directs this indie romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: Based on the real-life kidnapping of legendary singer Frank Sinatra's son in 1963, but infused with a massive dose of humor and imagination, this dramatic comedy by director Ron Underwood attempts to root out the mindset of the three perpetrators (played to great effect by William H. Macy, David Arquette and Thomas Ian Nicholas). Considering they're no experts, the plan is understandably doomed before it's even set into hilarious motion.

link.synopsis: Legendary comedian Rodney Dangerfield liked to joke that he just got "no respect." But this compilation proves he deserves heaps of it for his innate and canny sense of timing and genius humor, which are all on display in this collection of his work. The appearances include stand-up performances, comedy specials and more. Viewers are in for a side-splitting, laugh-a-minute journey into the top-rate entertainer's mind.

link.synopsis: La Marcha Verde is a double threat; it's a musical and a sexy comedy that celebrates without a hint of nostalgia the disappearance of two seminal Spanish realities: the colonial army and a musical called "Revista." Prepare to enjoy some dizzying arias, hot-blooded ballads and kooky humor served up Spanish style in this extraordinary melodic treat starring Fedra Lorente, Álvaro de Luna and Jordi Dauder.

The Other Side of the Bed
How to be a Woman and not Die in the Attempt

link.synopsis: History makes great fodder for comedy in this hilarious collection of archival film footage and public service announcements. This unusual documentary reveals the paranoia and hysteria of postwar America, a time when the Red Scare appeared to take over common sense, when teenagers and their wayward hormones morphed into a national problem, and when the threat of nuclear war drove citizens to sidesplitting despair.

link.synopsis: This Australian comedy gem stars Gia Carides as romance novelist Sophie, who finds herself in a predicament straight from the pages of her books when she meets -- and falls in love with -- a cat burglar (Anthony LaPaglia) specializing in jewel heists. But before Sophie can give herself completely over to fate, she must conquer her insecurities … and edge out her paramour's firmly ensconced fiancée, Gloria (Rebecca Gibney).

link.synopsis: In the pivotal summer between the end of high school and the beginning of college, a group of kids is forced to face the challenges of growing up and getting on with their lives. Falling in tone somewhere between director Larry Clark's dark, disturbing film Kids and the glossy comedy Can't Hardly Wait, Wrestling exposes the complexities that are a fact of life for many suburban teens.

link.synopsis: Traci Lords, Paul Johansson, Sherilyn Fenn and Mariette Hartley star in this romantic comedy. Magazine editor Max Normane (Lords) has it all: looks, brains and self-assurance. She lacks one thing she wants, though -- a baby. Hard-to-please Max wants a progeny who can edit &NFi;and&NFi_; write, so when egotistical but gifted author Jake Benjamin (Johansson) enters her life, she makes a Faustian bargain: Jake's sperm in return for publishing his book.

link.synopsis: Radio entertainers Mill (Madis Milling) and Norm (Henrik Normann) blur the line between reality and fantasy in this offbeat comedy. The two easygoing guys hide out in the broadcasting station, entertaining listeners with tales of a simpler life and a cast of colorful characters. As they immerse themselves in their tales, Mill and Norm lose their grip on reality, acting out their fantasies on live radio. Piret Laurimaa and Robert Gutman also star.

link.synopsis: What's enterprising real-estate agent Julia (Carmen Maura) to do when she finds 300 million pesetas and a corpse in a building where she's trying to sell an apartment? Do what's right and turn everything over to the police, solve the crime herself, or consider herself lucky for stumbling upon a treasure trove of loot? That's the dilemma that unfolds in this delicious black comedy about life, death and strange neighbors.

link.synopsis: Nature-show host Bill Gaime (Stephen Wilder) goes wild when he learns that his wife, Judy (Kim Helms), is having an affair with his co-host, Jim (Adam Lamas), in this offbeat comedy. As if that's not enough, the entire set soon turns into a deranged zoo thanks to a mutant weevil, dancing midgets, reptilian bunnies and a moody daughter. Chaos reigns, leaving Bill in desperate need of a guidebook for surviving the 21st century.

link.synopsis: Ace and Cool Breeze feverishly dream of becoming the next rap superstars. So, they make a deal with a pair of shady promoters and get a loan from a shylock dubbed Daddy T. But when the promoters skip town with the dough, Daddy wants his literal pound of flesh from the two wannabes, who have to hightail it to the Bahamas to hustle up the cash -- or they'll soon be missing some vital body parts. Dr. Dré and Ed Lover star in this urban comedy.

link.synopsis: In this mistaken-identity, screwball comedy based on an Oscar Wilde novel, high-tech tycoon Paul (Brad Rowe) yearns to find love but can't believe someone would want him for more than just his money. So, he pretends he's Earnest, a guy who barely ekes out a living. But the situation becomes complicated when he finally meets the perfect woman, Olivia (Susan Ward) -- and discovers how hard it is to tell her the truth.

link.synopsis: Rock 'n' roll music mixed with rockabilly is at the forefront of this fast-paced crime flick set in 1957 Dallas. Comedy reaches new heights when one of the baddies finds himself forced to dance to a driving rock 'n' roll beat. Highlights include original music and live performances by up-and-coming bands from the Lone Star State's rock and rockabilly scenes; Don Coats, Preacher Smith and Roscoe Gordon appear as themselves.

link.synopsis: Jamie Foxx is at his riotous best as host of this collection of sidesplitting stand-up routines culled from America's hippest urban comedy festival. Originally aired on Showtime, the program features the finest up-and-coming comics, including hilarious performances by Sherri Shepherd, Juan Villareal, Mike Bonner and Spike Davis, among others. Look no further if you want to see the next generation of comedians at the top of their game.

link.synopsis: After a wild party, the corpse of a guest named Sean is discovered by the river. Although the death is ruled an accident, Sean's girlfriend (Katrin Cartlidge) is skeptical. She launches into her own private investigation (via multiple roles and disguises), which leads her from the upper echelons of London society to its underbelly. This mix of black comedy, sex and violence is helmed by British director Constantine Giannaris.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Siraj Khan, Bharati Sharma, Alok Nath and Avtar Gill star in this quirky comedy about two opposites who share the same dream. Bhola, a clumsy but sweet aspiring actor, arrives in Mumbai with high hopes of becoming a movie star. His writer uncle (Virendra Saxena) helps Bhola get into film school, where he meets a lovely American student named Raveena. They begin to fall in love, but can two people struggling for stardom make it work?
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this romantic comedy, businessman Sanjay (Aslam Khan) is mad for Neela (Mallika Kapur); cricketeer Vinod (Aman Sondhi) loves Shree (Jonita Doda); and singer Deepak (Vikas Kalantri) is taken with Sherry (Divya Palat). As they woo their dream girls, a case of mistaken identity occurs, and all three men must pretend to be someone else. Amidst the confusion, crime boss Tundabhai (Rajpal Yadav) shows up and proclaims his love for all three ladies.
link.title: synopsis
Love Ke Liye Kuch Bhi Karega

link.synopsis: Tanishaa, Akshay Kapoor and Rashmi Nigam star in this heartwarming comedy about a group of friends who struggle to adapt to life after college. The film follows friends Rahul, Tania and Goldie from their college years through their personal struggles to find identity, fulfillment and love in the real world. As they experience life's painful ups and downs, romances blossom and fade. Yash Tonk also stars.
link.title: synopsis
Alag: He Is Different.... He Is Alone...

link.synopsis: A matchmaker goes a bit overboard in this comedy featuring stage star Mike Burstein in a dual role as the Lemel twins. The story centers on a matchmaker who finds the perfect-looking boy for the daughter of a wealthy client, but the suitor isn't rich, or very bright. As if this weren't enough, the matchmaker can't find a match for his own daughter. Finally, both girls take matters into their own hands and end up with the perfect match.
link.title: synopsis
Bill Hicks Live: Satirist, Social Critic, Stand-up Comedian
Bar the Alien in Kids' World

link.synopsis: Actor and singer Mike Burstein reprises his dual role as twins in this musical comedy sequel to 2 Kuni Lemel. Burstein stars as the hilarious Lemel twins, Kumi and Muni, who set off to Egypt on a mission to bring an Israeli Torah to a Jewish neighborhood in Cairo, in exchange for valuable coins. This movie marks the first time an Israeli film crew shot in Egypt. Extras include the film trailer and previews.
link.title: synopsis
Turn Left at the End of the World
The Man in the Glass Booth
